entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 20.1 a-b** *ब्राह्मे पौरंदरे चास्त्रे निष्ठितो गुरुशासनात्*
Who is determined to win in battle today?
A) Arjuna B) Bhīma C) Yudhiṣṭhira D) Kṛṣṇa
entry.answer: B) Bhīma • The verse states Bhīma's resolve to win, implied by his later actions. • Arjuna and Kṛṣṇa are elsewhere in the battle (cf. later verses). • Yudhiṣṭhira is not directly linked to this resolve in the text.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 24.1 a-b** *ततो भीमः समुत्क्षिप्य बाहुभ्यां शल्यमाहवे*
Who slew Śalya at noon?
A) Arjuna B) Bhīma C) Kṛṣṇa D) Drona
entry.answer: B) Bhīma • Bhīma's direct action is confirmed in the next verse (25). • Arjuna and Kṛṣṇa are engaged elsewhere (cf. 21-22). • Drona is not mentioned in this context.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 28.1 a-b** *को हि राधासुतं कर्मं शक्तो योधयितुं रणे*
Who is the son of Radha capable of fighting in battle?
A) Arjuna B) Kṛṣṇa C) Bhīma D) Duryodhana
entry.answer: B) Kṛṣṇa • Kṛṣṇa is explicitly the son of Devakī (Radha in some traditions). • Arjuna and Bhīma are not described as Radha's son. • Duryodhana is unrelated to this lineage.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 32.1 a-b** *तत्कर्म भीमस्य समीक्ष्य कृष्णः; कुन्तीसुतौ तौ परिशङ्कमानः*
Who restrained the kings after observing Bhīma's act?
A) Arjuna B) Drona C) Kṛṣṇa D) Yudhiṣṭhira
entry.answer: C) Kṛṣṇa • Kṛṣṇa is the only one explicitly mentioned as acting here. • Arjuna and Yudhiṣṭhira are not linked to this action. • Drona is absent from this scene.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 34.1 a-b** *वृत्तो ब्रह्मोत्तरो रङ्गः पाञ्चाली ब्राह्मणैर्वृता*
What was the battlefield called after being surrounded by Brahmins?
A) Kuru Field B) Brahma's Arena C) Pāñcāla's Court D) Duryodhana's Fort
entry.answer: B) Brahma's Arena • The term "Brahmottara" directly references Brahma. • Pāñcāla's court is a separate location. • Kuru Field and Duryodhana's Fort are unrelated to this description.

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 35.1 a-b** *ब्राह्मणैस्तु प्रतिच्छन्नौ रौरवाजिनवासिभिः*
Who were hidden by Brahmins in Rourava's city?
A) Arjuna and Bhīma B) Yudhiṣṭhira and Kṛṣṇa C) Drona and Kripa D) Draupadi and Kunti
entry.answer: A) Arjuna and Bhīma • The text explicitly names Arjuna and Bhīma. • Other pairs are not mentioned in this context. • Draupadi and Kunti are not associated with this event.

entry.question:

A) Kṛṣṇa and Arjuna B) Bhīma and Yudhiṣṭhira C) Duryodhana and Karna D) Draupadi and Subhadra

entry.question:
**Shalya-parvan 37.1 a-b** *माता बहुविधं विनाशं पर्यचिन्तयत्*
Who mourned the destruction of her sons?
A) Kunti B) Draupadi C) Gandhari D) Subhadra
entry.answer: A) Kunti • Kunti is explicitly the mother of the Pāṇḍavas. • Draupadi and Subhadra are not described as mourning here. • Gandhari is associated with Duryodhana's fate.

entry.question:

entry.answer: A) Pāṇḍavas • The text implies the Pāṇḍavas survived despite being known. • Brahmins and Kṛṣṇa are not the focus here. • Draupadi's survival is separate from this context.

entry.question:

entry.answer: C) Yudhiṣṭhira • The text suggests Yudhiṣṭhira's perspective was altered. • Kṛṣṇa and Bhīma are not linked to this reversal. • Duryodhana's fate is unrelated to Vyāsa's opinion.
